thread.title: A look at the Mets' history in postseason elimination games
thread.title_full: A look at the Mets' history in postseason elimination games | NJ.com

author: Maria Guardado | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: A look at the Mets' history in postseason elimination games
text:
NEW YORK — The Mets had a chance to close out their National League Division Series on Tuesday at Citi Field, but the Los Angeles Dodgers emerged with a 3-1 win to force a Game 5 on Thursday at Dodger Stadium.
The best-of-five series will now come down to a do-or-die elimination game, with the winner moving on to face the Chicago Cubs in the NLCS . Of course, it's not the first time the Mets have faced this type of situation in their postseason history. In 13 elimination games, the Mets have gone 8-5.
PLUS : Clayton Kershaw on Zack Greinke vs. Jacob deGrom in Game 5
Here's a breakdown of how they've fared:
1973 (1-1) • The Mets, managed by the late Yogi Berra, reached the postseason despite finishing with an unspectacular 82-79 record and went on to beat the Cincinnati Reds in five games in the NLCS. They won Game 5 at Shea Stadium, 7-2, behind their ace Tom Seaver.
• The Mets advanced to the World Series but fell to the Oakland Athletics in seven games. New York took a 3-2 series lead after Game 5, but the A's won the next two games in Oakland to repeat as World Champions. Jon Matlack came back to pitch Game 7 for the Mets on three days' rest but took the loss after the A's won, 5-2.
1986 (2-0) • After winning the NL pennant by defeating the Houston Astros in six games, the Mets moved on to face the Boston Red Sox in the World Series. The Mets were on the verge of elimination when the Red Sox took a 3-2 series lead, but they forced a Game 7 by winning Game 6, 6-5, in 10 innings. The series then returned to Shea, where the Mets won the deciding game, 8-5, to clinch their second World Championship in franchise history.
1988 (1-1) • The Mets went up against the Los Angeles Dodgers in the NLCS but lost in seven games. Down 3-2 in the series heading into Game 6, David Cone kept the Mets alive by leading them to a 5-1 win at Dodger Stadium. Though the series returned to New York, the Mets were eliminated after losing Game 7 by a score of 6-0.
1999 (3-1) • The Mets finished second in the NL East but won the NL Wild Card by beating the Cincinnati Reds in a one-game playoff.
• After defeating the Arizona Diamondbacks in four games in the division series, the Mets moved on to face the Atlanta Braves in the NLCS. The Braves won the first three games to take a commanding 3-0 lead in the series before the Mets won two straight to fend off elimination. Still, Atlanta closed it out in Game 6 by with a slim 10-9 win at Turner Field.
2000 (0-1) • The Mets captured the NL Wild Card for the second straight year and then dispatched the San Francisco Giants in four games to reach the NLCS. After defeating the St. Louis Cardinals in five games, the Mets advanced to the World Series to play the Yankees. The Yankees ultimately won the Subway Series matchup and clinched with a 4-2 victory in Game 5 at Shea.
2006 (1-1) • The Mets swept the Dodgers in the NLDS to advance to the second round and face the Cardinals. Down 3-2 in the series heading into Game 6, the Mets won, 4-2, to force a Game 7. The Mets and Cardinals were tied, 1-1, in the 9th before Yadier Molina blasted a two-run homer to give St. Louis a 3-1 lead. Adam Wainwright then pitched a scoreless bottom of the ninth to seal the Cardinals' win.
